modules.description: This module defines and manipulates HTTP services with typed endpoints, handling request methods, path parameters, query parameters, input/output encodings, and error representations. It supports constructing services for standard HTTP methods (GET, POST, DELETE, PATCH, PUT) with precise path routing and parameter handling, enabling the creation of strongly-typed RESTful APIs. Concrete use cases include defining API endpoints with specific path hierarchies, encoding request inputs and outputs, and generating request builders for client-side API consumption.

This module constructs responses for services in a server directory, providing functions to return plain values or streaming data as answers. It handles the final step of service execution by packaging outputs into a format suitable for transmission over a network. Use it to send single values or continuous streams of data back to clients making requests to registered services.

This module supports operations for constructing and managing typed HTTP services with path and query parameter handling, enabling service registration, conflict resolution, and dynamic directory routing. It operates on typed directory structures that map endpoints to service handlers, using combinators to enforce static guarantees and encodings for request/response processing. Typical applications include building RESTful APIs with introspection capabilities and servers that dynamically generate subdirectories based on request patterns.

This module implements typed HTTP service directories for building servers that route requests to registered services. It provides operations to construct, manage, and query hierarchical service structures with support for path and query parameter parsing, conflict resolution, and dynamic routing. Use it to define RESTful APIs where services are organized in a tree-like structure, enabling precise endpoint matching and introspection.
